title: White House says no U.S. shutdown-related layoffs yet, but warns they could come
description: On Capitol Hill, Republicans and Democrats showed no signs they would end the standoff any time soon.

title: Trump says he’s open to health care deal but government must reopen first
IND vs PAK: MCC shushes Pakistan; settles controversy vs India
description: The MCC has upheld the third umpire's decision to declare Muneeba Ali run out against India, clarifying a key cricket law. Despite grounding her bat, Muneeba's dismissal was correct as she wasn't running or diving towards her crease when the wicket was broken. This ruling ensures clarity on the 'bouncing bat' law.

title: Staffing issues cause delays at several US airports, says FAA as government shutdown persists
Law students from Karnataka duped of Rs 1 lakh amid house hunting in Delhi
'They were ready to go': Trump again claims that he stopped India-Pak conflict
description: US President Donald Trump claims he resolved India-Pakistan tensions using tariffs, stating he prevented wars. He asserted tariffs make the US a "peacekeeper." However, India maintains de-escalation followed direct military talks, with Prime Minister Modi clarifying no foreign leader pressured India to halt Operation Sindoor after a deadly terror attack.

title: Movie ticket price cap: Why Karnataka HC stayed the govt’s move, the larger debate

Happy Valmiki Jayanti 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share
description: Valmiki Jayanti honours Sage Valmiki, the revered author of the ancient epic Ramayana and Adi Kavi. Celebrated across India, this day commemorates his birth and timeless teachings on righteousness, devotion, and virtuous living. The article offers heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes for 2025, encouraging reflection on his profound wisdom and inspiring communities to uphold truth and virtue.

title: Libra Horoscope Today, 07 October 2025: Emotional fatigue eases the moment you’re with your partner
'Rohit will be 41 in 2027 WC': Ex-cricketer justifies captaincy change
description: Shubman Gill is the new ODI captain for India's Australia tour.  This move prepares for the 2027 World Cup.  Rohit Sharma, the current captain, will not lead the ODI side.  Gill aims to win the World Cup.  India will play around 20 ODIs before the tournament.  Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will return to cricket.

description: Former Indian captain Sunil Gavaskar has voiced strong criticism of the West Indies bowling unit.  Following India's decisive innings and 140-run victory in Ahmedabad, Gavaskar questioned the quality of the West Indies attack.  He contrasted the current team with past legendary West Indian players, highlighting a perceived decline in batting talent.  The second Test is set for New Delhi.

title: A hundred years ago | Anti-malaria Congress

description: This round of negotiations, launched on the eve of the second anniversary of Hamas's October 7, 2023, attack that sparked the war, "may last for several days"

title: CM Stalin inaugurates hospital buildings, hands over enhanced pension to retired priests
description: The CM also virtually inaugurated 20 hostels, 37 school buildings and housing units under the Tholkudi programme, 16 village knowledge centres and nine multi-purpose centres constructed by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department at a total cost of ₹209 crore.

title: Four arrested for stealing mobile phones at liquor shops in Chennai
description: Based on CCTV footage and inquiries, the police identified and arrested four suspects

title: T.N. Higher Education Minister inaugurates skill development centre for differently abled students
description: The centre, named Sudar Oli, will have an annual intake of 60 differently abled students

title: ‘Global South scientists can tip red tape by thinking, working together’
description: Bureaucratic delays, outdated procurement rules, and chronic underfunding are all hallmarks of doing science in India. But according to Sammy Wambua from Pwani University in Kenya, there are reasons to be optimistic and to believe creativity and solidarity can keep science ticking even in the toughest environments

title: AC suburban train services of Southern Railway yet to achieve one-fourth of total carrying capacity
description: Commuters particularly using the Beach-Tambaram-Chengalpattu section blame the higher fare, mismatch in timing of the operation of train services, and the use of Metro Rail services for last-mile connectivity.

title: Five arrested for pushing minor girl into prostitution
description: The arrests followed an investigation into a case that surfaced in August, when the Anti-Vice Squad rescued a Class 9 girl from a lodge in Koyambedu.

description: T.R.B. Rajaa also stressed on more research in the field of animal husbandry and land use.

Only 14! India must fast-track Suryavanshi like Tendulkar
description: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, 14, is India’s record-breaking prodigy - creating milestones in youth ODIs, T20s, and first-class cricket. Coaches like Zubin Bharucha and Vikram Rathour believe he’s ready to be “blooded” into India A or the senior team immediately. Grounded, fearless, and far ahead of his peers, Suryavanshi could be India’s next big superstar.

description: About ten fish varieties soon to get MSC certification, another seven under process

Carcass of 'poached' tiger found in MP, 2 forest officials suspended
description: A decomposed tiger carcass, suspected to be a poaching victim, was discovered in Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve. Forest officials have suspended two personnel for alleged negligence. The State Tiger Strike Force is investigating the cause of death. Meanwhile, a tigress and her three cubs are also reported missing, raising further concerns within the reserve.

title: Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma to lead ‘Pravasi Rajasthani Meet’ in Surat on Oct 8
Madhya Pradesh: 100s of voter IDs found in pond; probe ordered
description: Hundreds of genuine voter ID cards, all from Ward No. 15, were discovered floating in Raja Talab in Chhatarpur district, Madhya Pradesh. Found inside a bag during a cleaning drive, locals claim they are undistributed cards. A preliminary inquiry has been ordered, sparking political accusations of irregularities.

title: Bhupendra Patel to inaugurate Vibrant Gujarat regional conference
description: The “Udyami Mela” and millet-themed food court will showcase local entrepreneurship and cuisine

title: Centre revises price list: CGHS rates for tests, procedures increased
description: Central government has updated rates for nearly 2,000 CGHS tests and procedures. This revision, effective October 13, aims to help over 40 lakh beneficiaries access treatment at top hospitals. Some rates have seen significant increases, with differential pricing based on hospital accreditation and city classification. This move addresses long-standing issues for beneficiaries.

title: India-Bangladesh ties: Hasina issue needs consultations, says Vikram Misri
description: India supports an early, free, and fair election in Bangladesh, stating that matters concerning former PM Sheikh Hasina are judicial and require consultations. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri emphasized India's readiness to engage with any government emerging from a popular mandate, despite acknowledging some issues in bilateral ties.

title: Sonowal accords ceremonial welcome to ‘Very Large Gas Carrier’ Shivalik
description: Shivalik represents a significant leap in India’s maritime and energy logistics capability.

title: NSA on Sonam Wangchuk: SC issues notice to Centre, UT on wife's plea
description: The Supreme Court issued a notice to the Centre and Ladakh UT regarding Sonam Wangchuk's wife's plea challenging his NSA detention. While refusing an interim order for the grounds of arrest to the wife, the court questioned why they should be withheld. The hearing is scheduled for October 14.

title: Thackeray brothers discussing Sena-MNS alliance, says Raut
description: Sanjay Raut confirms that Uddhav and Raj Thackeray are exploring an alliance for civic body polls

title: Jaipur SMS hospital fire: 2 police officers brave flames to rescue patients
description: Two constables, Hari Mohan and Lalit Sharma, bravely entered a burning ICU at SMS Hospital to evacuate critically ill patients. Despite heavy smoke and personal distress, they rescued at least 12 patients, including a boy with a head injury. Their quick actions, alongside hospital staff, ensured most patients were safely moved before the fire claimed six lives.

title: World Junior Championships: India off to flying start; Sri Lanka edge UAE in thriller
description: The mixed team championships is being played under a new best of three relay-scoring format

title: Daily Horoscope Today, October 7, 2025: Comprehensive Astrological Predictions for Libra, Leo, Pisces, Aries, and All Zodiac Signs
Attack on CJI Gavai: Political leaders unite in condemnation
description: Political leaders across party lines have condemned the attack on Chief Justice of India, Justice BR Gavai. Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to the CJI, calling the act reprehensible and unacceptable in society. Opposition leaders expressed anguish, labeling the incident "unprecedented, shameful and abhorrent," and an assault on the Constitution and judiciary.

title: Lawyer tries to hurl shoe at CJI in court; suspended
description: A lawyer's attempt to hurl shoes at Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai in an SC courtroom was thwarted by security. The lawyer, shouting slogans, was later released. The incident, linked to social media distortions about the CJI's remarks, has drawn widespread condemnation from legal bodies and political parties, who view it as an attack on judicial independence.

title: Pulisic penalty miss denies Milan top spot after 0-0 draw at Juventus
description: Milan have 13 points, third in the standings and two points behind leaders Napoli and Roma, while Juventus are a further point back in fifth, behind Inter on goal difference

title: NDA banks on 'Viksit Bihar' plank to counter opposition caste-based drive
description: The NDA, led by BJP and JDU, anticipates a strong victory in Bihar polls, campaigning on a platform of development and good governance, aiming to move past the 'Jungle Raj' era. Opinion polls project a landslide win for the alliance, while the opposition INDIA bloc is expected to focus on caste-based politics.

title: Madison Beer’s confession resurfaces after sideline moment with Justin Herbert
description: Los Angeles Chargers' star Justin Herbert and singer Madison Beer were seen sharing a romantic moment on the sidelines, seemingly confirming their relationship after weeks of speculation. Beer previously spoke about overcoming self-doubt and believing she deserved love. Herbert had previously denied their romance, calling Beer a friend he met through chess.

title: F&O trading: SEBI Chief says retail investors should assess risk capacity, avoid speculative trades
Cough syrup row: Madhya Pradesh drug controller transferred, 3 others suspended
description: Tragedy struck Chhindwara as 15 children died after allegedly consuming Coldrif cough syrup. In response, Madhya Pradesh transferred its drugs controller and suspended three subordinates. The Chief Minister visited affected families, while police arrested a doctor who prescribed the syrup. The NHRC has ordered inquiries and sample testing across multiple states.

title: West Bengal: BJP MP & MLA assaulted during flood tour
description: BJP MP Khagen Murmu and MLA Sankar Ghosh were assaulted by villagers in Jalpaiguri while inspecting flood-hit areas. The lawmakers suffered injuries, and their vehicles were ransacked. Prime Minister Modi condemned the incident, citing the state's poor law and order, while TMC leaders suggested villagers were angered by a perceived photo-op.

title: Bengal floods: Toll hits 36, five of the victims are from Nepal
description: Flood waters receding in north Bengal have revealed eight more bodies, bringing the total death toll to 36. Chief Minister Banerjee announced Rs 5 lakh compensation and jobs for families of the deceased, while addressing the devastation in Mirik and promising swift restoration of a key bridge.

title: Tom Brady says he felt distant from Gisele Bündchen before split
description: Tom Brady once revealed cracks in his marriage with Gisele Bündchen, admitting she felt he wasn't contributing enough to family life. Years later, the couple divorced in 2022. While Brady remains single, Bündchen has reportedly started a new family with her boyfriend, Joaquim Valente, two and a half years post-divorce.

title: Jaipur ICU blaze: Hospital staff ignored early warnings, say patients' kin
description: Families of victims in the Sawai Man Singh Hospital fire accused staff of ignoring smoke warnings and fleeing. Attendants claim their pleas were dismissed, and hospital personnel were the first to escape. Protests erupted as officials visited, with grieving relatives demanding answers about their loved ones' conditions amidst alleged police interference.

title: MUDA scam case: ED attaches 34 more properties worth over Rs 40 crore
description: The Enforcement Directorate has attached 34 more properties valued at over Rs 40 crore in the Mysore Urban Development Authority (MUDA) land scam case, bringing the total to over Rs 440 crore.

title: ‘In loving memory of Sobha, our Jaan Bhai:’ Sikhs in US hold ‘Sehaj Paath’ for a gurdwara horse
Electing Zohran Mamdani as Mayor would give Trump excuse to take over New York, says Andrew Cuomo
Donald Trump thanks Brittany Mahomes amid fan buzz over Taylor Swift fallout
description: Brittany Mahomes' public support for Donald Trump has sparked online backlash and resurfaced past statements. Amidst this, rumors suggest a fallout with Taylor Swift, with fans speculating Swift's new song 'Cancelled' is about their alleged rift. While Brittany has defended her political stance, Patrick Mahomes remains private about his beliefs.

title: Rajasthan: Blaze at Jaipur's SMS hospital kills 8 in ICU; high court asks 'what's happening '
description: Eight critically ill patients perished in a devastating fire at Jaipur's SMS Medical College Neuro ICU late Sunday. The blaze, suspected to be a short-circuit, spread rapidly, with allegations of delayed response and staff fleeing. The Rajasthan government has announced compensation and ordered a safety audit, suspending officials and cancelling a fire safety agency's contract.

title: Facility for organ transplant institute to become operational in three months in Kozhikode

title: With Japan, South Korea and Vietnam as partner countries, first Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference to kick off in Mehsana on Oct 9
Bihar assembly elections: BJP, Tejashwi eye spring in autumn of the patriarchs
description: Bihar will vote in assembly polls on November 6 and 11. The Election Commission announced the schedule for 243 seats. Counting will take place on November 14. The elections are set to be a contest between the ruling coalition and the opposition alliance. Voter awareness and improved law and order are cited for the shorter poll duration.

title: We need an urban climate emergency fund
description: Disaster recovery cannot depend on ad hoc grants or delayed relief measures

title: Spurs legend Tony Parker’s father passes away unexpectedly at 70
description: Tony Parker Sr., father of NBA legend Tony Parker, has passed away at 70. A former professional player himself, he later managed his son's career, contributing significantly to the Parker family's basketball dynasty. The basketball world mourns his sudden loss, with tributes pouring in for his dedication to the sport and his lasting influence.

description: Stephen Curry is facing backlash online after posting an inspirational message, with fans criticizing his wife, Ayesha Curry, for recent comments about her life plans. Ayesha Curry's remarks on the 'Call Her Daddy' podcast, where she expressed not wanting marriage or children, have ignited a debate. Neither Stephen nor Ayesha has publicly addressed the ongoing criticism.

title: Applications invited for specialist in financial literacy for DHEW
In blow to Senthil, SC says order 'very clear' against him holding public office
description: The Supreme Court has declined to clarify its stance on former Tamil Nadu minister V Senthil Balaji holding public office. The court stated its previous order was clear. Balaji had sought clarification after resigning following the court's objection to him becoming a minister soon after bail. The bench suggested transferring the trial in the cash-for-job scam.

description: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar declined to provide a specific figure for illegal foreign immigrants removed from Bihar's electoral rolls. He stated the data is decentralized with electoral registration officers. Kumar highlighted over 68 lakh deletions overall due to death, shifting, or being untraced, with foreign nationals potentially included in the 'untraced' category.

title: Trump tariffs: US President announces 25% levies on medium, heavy-duty truck imports
description: US President Donald Trump has announced a significant 25% tariff on all medium and heavy-duty trucks entering the United States, effective November 1, 2025. This move, aimed at bolstering domestic manufacturing and protecting American truck makers from foreign competition, follows a Commerce Department probe into predatory trade practices.  The tariff is part of a broader protectionist agenda.

This antidote helped save children in Madhya Pradesh who suffered severe kidney damage and brain injury after consuming the contaminated syrup, preventing further fatalities.

Ladakh unrest: Leh group questions government’s normalcy claim

The group demands internet restoration, an end to arrests, and the lifting of restrictions to rebuild public confidence.

description: Prime Minister says the incident highlights “absolutely pathetic law and order situation in West Bengal”. Mamata Banerjee said that it was unfortunate that PM chose to politicise a natural disaster without waiting for a proper investigation.

title: CJI Gavai’s calm demeanour is reminiscent of predecessor’s presence of mind 57 years ago before a knife-wielding attacker
description: On March 13, 1968, then Chief Justice of India M. Hidayatullah wrestled a knife-wielding man in the court room to save his fellow judge Justice A.N. Grover’s life. After a police officer cuffed the assailant, the CJI asked the officer not to manhandle the man.

description: Young batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, 14, hopped on a video call with Rajasthan Royals batting coach Vikram Rathour. Suryavanshi is currently in Australia with the India U19 squad, preparing for their second Youth Test. He recently scored a blistering 113 off 86 balls in the first Youth Test against Australia U19.

title: Will Xavier Worthy play tonight? Chiefs WR listed as questionable vs Jaguars
description: Rookie sensation Xavier Worthy is expected to play for the Kansas City Chiefs in their Week 5 Monday Night Football game against the Jacksonville Jaguars. Despite a late addition to the injury report with shoulder and ankle concerns, reports indicate his listing is precautionary. His presence is seen as a game-changer for the Chiefs' offense.

Bihar Assembly polls to be held in two phases on November 6 and 11; counting on November 14
description: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar also announces bye-election to eight constituencies across seven States on November 11. In Bihar, the gazette notification for the first phase of polling will be issued on October 10, and the last date to file nominations is October 17. For the second phase, the notification will be issued on October 13, and the last date to file nominations is October 20.

description: The SOP follows certain accidents involving ‘giant wheels’, and will apply to permanent Ferris wheels at amusement parks and temporary ones at trade fairs, exhibitions, and temple festivals

Is it regular back pain or pancreatic cancer? How to recognise warning signs
description: Back pain, now common across age groups, is usually benign but can rarely mask serious conditions like pancreatic cancer. This article reveals how persistent back pain, particularly when accompanied by unexplained weight loss, jaundice, or digestive issues, might be a critical warning sign. Early pancreatic cancer symptoms are often subtle, making differentiation crucial for timely diagnosis and improved treatment outcomes.

How eating a single clove daily can improve heart health & manage cholesterol
description: Discover how the humble clove, a common kitchen spice, offers significant benefits for heart health. Rich in eugenol and antioxidants, cloves can effectively lower bad cholesterol (LDL) while boosting good cholesterol (HDL), reducing inflammation, and combating oxidative stress. Just one clove daily may protect against heart disease and improve overall cardiovascular function, according to recent studies.

Arattai launch: Anand Mahindra backs ‘Made in India’ app; Zoho founder replies
description: Zoho's homegrown messaging app, Arattai, recently gained immense popularity, topping Indian app stores as a "spyware-free, made-in-India" alternative. Industrialist Anand Mahindra publicly endorsed the app, prompting a grateful response from Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu. Despite its rapid rise, Arattai is currently addressing user-reported issues like OTP delays and call glitches.

title: Vanessa Bryant melts hearts cuddling her puppy; calls herself 'proud dog mom'
description: Vanessa Bryant recently warmed hearts by sharing endearing photos and videos with her tiny white puppy on Instagram, playfully embracing her "dog mom" era. This isn't her first pet, as she also has a German Shepherd named Loki, continuing a long tradition of pet ownership and sharing moments of love and healing with her followers.

title: Inside Alex Ovechkin and Anastasia Shubskaya’s love story
description: Alex Ovechkin's record-breaking hockey career, culminating in surpassing Wayne Gretzky's goal record in April 2025, is deeply intertwined with the unwavering support of his wife, Anastasia Shubskaya. Her background in modeling and film, coupled with their shared family values, forms the heart behind his legendary achievements, making her an indispensable factor in his success.

title: Connor McDavid’s Oilers future in doubt as owner Daryl Katz grows impatient
description: Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid's contract uncertainty is causing significant unease within the franchise as he enters his final year. Owner Daryl Katz is reportedly "antsy" over the delay, despite no animosity. NHL insider Darren Dreger suggests a 50-50 chance of an extension, possibly a short-term deal, leaving the team's future in McDavid's hands.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
description: SpaceX secured five of seven critical US Space Force military launch missions for the upcoming fiscal year, totaling $714 million, reinforcing its dominance in Pentagon space contracts. United Launch Alliance received the remaining two missions. Blue Origin's New Glenn remains uncertified, missing out on this cycle's awards, though a NASA Mars mission could advance its prospects.

title: Oral microbes found as new risk factor for pancreatic cancer
description: A groundbreaking study reveals a surprising link between oral microbes and pancreatic cancer risk. Researchers found certain bacteria and fungi, including those causing gum disease, significantly raise the likelihood of developing this deadly "silent killer." This discovery offers new avenues for early detection through oral microbiome profiling and prevention strategies, urging further research into causation.
